Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions | Variables
PDM - Pulse Density Modulation
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides an API for configuring, controlling, and managing the Pulse Density Modulation (PDM) peripheral on Apollo5 devices. It supports audio data acquisition, gain control, DMA, and interrupt handling for digital microphone and audio applications.

Key Features

  1. Digital Microphone Support: Interface with PDM microphones.
  2. DMA Transfer: High-speed data transfer using DMA.
  3. FIFO Management: Handle PDM FIFO operations and thresholds.
  4. Clock Configuration: Flexible clock source selection and configuration.
  5. Power Management: Low-power operation and power state control.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure the PDM peripheral
  • Set up DMA for PDM data transfer
  • Manage FIFO operations and data reading
  • Handle PDM interrupts and status monitoring
  • Support for power management and clock configuration

Usage

  1. Initialize the PDM using am_hal_pdm_initialize()
  2. Configure the PDM with am_hal_pdm_configure()
  3. Set up DMA for data transfer
  4. Enable the PDM and start data acquisition
  5. Handle PDM data and interrupts

Configuration

  • USE_PDM_TWO_STAGE_DMA: Enable/disable two-stage DMA pipeline
  • Clock Selection: Configure PDM clock sources and frequencies
  • FIFO Thresholds: Set up FIFO threshold levels
  • DMA: Configure DMA for PDM data transfer

◆ AM_HAL_PDM_DMA_THRESHOLD_MIN

#define AM_HAL_PDM_DMA_THRESHOLD_MIN   (16)

DMA threshold minimum.

The PDM DMA works best if its threshold value is set to a multiple of 4 between 16 and 24, but it will technically allow threshold settings between 4 and 24. This macro sets the minimum threshold value that the HAL layer will allow.

◆ USE_PDM_TWO_STAGE_DMA

#define USE_PDM_TWO_STAGE_DMA

Enable the two-stage DMA request pipeline feature.

This feature is added to ease SW ISR latency requirement to reload next DMA request when the current DMA request is completed.

To disable the 2-stage DMA feature, undefine this macro. The user needs to ensure that the response time of the DMACPL ISR is less than the time it takes for the PDM FIFO (typically with a size of 16 words) to become filled, or else data loss may occur.

To enable the 2-stage DMA feature, define ths macro. The user has a longer response time for the DMACPL ISR, which is approximately equal to the time it takes to fill the entire DMA buffer.

◆ am_hal_pdm_clkspd_e

enum am_hal_pdm_clkspd_e

PDM internal clock speed selection.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFXTAL 

External crystal oscillator.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFRC_24MHZ 

HFRC 24 MHz, the actual frequency may change if HFADJ is enabled.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFRC_1P5MHZ 

HFRC 1.5 MHz, the actual frequency may change if HFADJ is enabled.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFRC_0P5MHZ 

HFRC 500 kHz, the actual frequency may change if HFADJ is enabled.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFXTAL_DIV2 

External crystal oscillator divide 2.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_HFXTAL_DIV4 

External crystal oscillator divide 4.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_EXTREF 

External reference clock from GPIO 15.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_PLL 

POSTDIV, an output of PLL.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_PLL_DIV16 

POSTDIV divide 16.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_PLL_DIV48 

POSTDIV divide 48.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_PLL_FOUT4 

FOUT4, an output of PLL, its frequency is equal to POSTDIV / 8.

AM_HAL_PDM_CLK_OFF 

A virtual clock used internally or by the application when the PDMI2S0 operates in slave mode.

◆ am_hal_pdm_data_flow_direction_e

enum am_hal_pdm_data_flow_direction_e

The data flow direction after PDM convertion.

The data can flow to memory via DMA, to external pads via I2S (a sub-module of PDM), or to both destinations simultaneously.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_PDM_DATA_FLOW_TO_MEMORY 
AM_HAL_PDM_DATA_FLOW_TO_I2S 
AM_HAL_PDM_DATA_FLOW_TO_BOTH

◆ am_hal_pdm_status_e

enum am_hal_pdm_status_e

PDM-specific error conditions.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_PDM_STATUS_BAD_TOTALCOUNT 

The PDM HAL will throw this error if it can't find a threshold value to match the total-count value passed in by a caller requesting a DMA transfer. The PDM hardware requires all DMA transactions to be evenly divisible in chunks of one FIFO size or smaller. Try changing your ui32TotalCount value to a more evenly divisible number.

◆ am_hal_pdm_dma_start()

uint32_t am_hal_pdm_dma_start ( void * pHandle,
am_hal_pdm_transfer_t * pDmaCfg )

PDM DMA NonBlocking Transfer Start.

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the interface.
pDmaCfg- Pointer to the PDM DMA Config
Note
If the data cache is enabled, ensure that the starting address of the DMA buffer is aligned to 32 bytes to meet the requirements of cache operations.
If the data cache is enabled, the invalidation of the RX DMA buffer is handled by the HAL in the am_hal_pdm_dma_get_buffer() function.
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
